questions.question_en: What are you most looking forward to at the start of the Autumn Term—new subjects, catching up with classmates, or extracurriculars?
questions.question_ch: 你最期待秋季学期开始时的什么——新科目、和同学见面，还是课外活动？
questions.answer_en: I’m most looking forward to diving back into the Insect Club after the long summer: lacing up my boots, hauling my binoculars and field guide across the school grounds, and spotting which beetles and butterflies have returned. Catching up with Gerald and Leslie under the oaks will be fun too, and learning new History topics about the Maya or Second World War will be exciting—but nothing beats the thrill of discovering real insects and sharing those finds with friends.
questions.answer_ch: 我最期待在漫长的夏季后重返昆虫俱乐部：系好我的靴子，背上望远镜和野外指南，穿越校园，观察哪些甲虫和蝴蝶回来了。和杰拉尔德与莱斯利在橡树下聊天也会很有趣，学习关于玛雅或第二次世界大战的新历史主题也很令人兴奋——但没有什么比发现真正的昆虫并与朋友分享这些发现更让人兴奋的了。

questions.question_en: Do you have any special plans for the October Half-term break, such as a short trip or a fun project at home?
questions.question_ch: 你有为十月半学期假期安排什么特别的计划吗，比如短途旅行或在家做一个有趣的项目？
questions.answer_en: This half-term I’m planning a mini autumn expedition rather than a long trip. Dad, Chen Jia and I will head to Kew Gardens and Richmond Park to map the changing leaves, tally migrating geese and sketch fungi in my nature notebook. Back home I’ll recruit Uncle Irvin’s help in his studio corner to build a simple wooden birdhouse so great tits might move in. I’ll carve a pumpkin lantern for Halloween, painting its face precisely, then test a batch of apple-and-marmalade scones in the kitchen—experimenting with added spices and oats. In the quieter mornings I’ll settle in my art corner to weave new “Light of the Elves” paper lanterns for the darker evenings. By mixing outdoor science, a bit of carpentry, cooking experiments and creative play, I think this break will be full of fun discoveries.
questions.answer_ch: 这个半学期我计划进行一次迷你秋季探险，而不是一次长途旅行。爸爸、陈佳和我将前往科尔花园和里士满公园，记录变化的树叶、数算候鸟大雁，并在我的自然笔记本上素描真菌。回到家后，我会请叔叔艾尔文在他的工作室里帮我制作一个简单的木鸟屋，让山雀能进来。我还会为万圣节雕刻一个南瓜灯，认真绘制它的面孔，然后在厨房试验一批苹果和橘子果酱司康饼，尝试添加香料和燕麦。在比较安静的早晨，我会在我的艺术角落里安顿下来，编织新的“精灵之光”纸灯笼，以迎接更黑暗的夜晚。通过混合户外科学、一些木工、烹饪实验和创意游戏，我认为这个假期将会充满乐趣和新发现。

questions.question_en: How does your school commemorate Remembrance Sunday, and what do you learn about its significance?
questions.question_ch: 你们学校如何纪念悼念星期日，你们从中学到了什么意义？
questions.answer_en: Every year in the week around Remembrance Sunday our whole school comes together first thing in the morning for a short assembly. We all wear poppy pins on our uniforms and our head girl reads out the names of former pupils who went to war. At exactly eleven o’clock the bells ring and we fall silent for two minutes, standing perfectly still, heads bowed. After the silence our headteacher, Mrs. MacFarlane, reminds us that it’s not just about looking back at the First and Second World Wars but honouring anyone who has died in conflict since then. In PSHE lessons we then talk about why we observe that silence and wear poppies: to remember the sacrifice of ordinary people—soldiers and civilians alike—and to remind ourselves that peace must never be taken for granted. We learn that those two minutes ‘‘give voice to our gratitude’’ and encourage us to treat others with kindness so that future generations won’t repeat the mistakes of the past.
questions.answer_ch: 每年在追念主日的那一周，我们整个学校会在早上的第一件事上聚在一起，举行一个简短的集会。我们都会在制服上佩戴罂粟花胸针，女校长会念出曾参加战争的前校友的名字。正午十一点，钟声响起，我们保持两分钟的沉默，静静站立，低下头。在沉默之后，我们的校长玛克法兰女士提醒我们，这不仅仅是回顾第一次和第二次世界大战，而是向自那以来在冲突中牺牲的每一个人致敬。在个人、社会和健康教育课上，我们谈论为什么要保持沉默并佩戴罂粟花：是为了纪念普通人的牺牲——无论是士兵还是平民——并提醒自己，和平永远不能被视为理所当然。我们了解到，那两分钟“表达了我们的感激之情”，并鼓励我们以善良对待他人，让未来的世代不重蹈过去的错误。

questions.question_en: Have you learned anything about Scottish heritage for St Andrew’s Day, and how do you celebrate or honor it?
questions.question_ch: 您是否了解过关于圣安德鲁节的苏格兰遗产？您如何庆祝或纪念它？
questions.answer_en: I did. In class Ms MacFarlane held a small assembly on November 30th: she told us how St Andrew, a fisherman-apostle, became Scotland’s patron saint and how the white saltire on a blue field is flown everywhere from Edinburgh Castle to village halls. We painted tiny saltire flags, heard a brief bagpipe demonstration by Mr Kenyatta and tried shortbread biscuits and tiny oatcakes at the school café. At home I read about tartan patterns and Highland clans in my Britannica Children’s Encyclopedia, learned that clans once raced their clansmen across glens to settle disputes, and read the legend of the Loch Ness Monster. That evening I taped a little felt saltire to my bedroom door, wore a borrowed tartan scarf, and we shared shortbread over cups of hot Irn-Bru while listening to “Flower of Scotland” on the BBC—quiet but lively, and it made me feel I’d really taken part in a piece of Scottish heritage.
questions.answer_ch: 在课堂上，麦克法伦女士于11月30日举行了一次小型集会：她告诉我们圣安德鲁，这位渔夫使徒，是如何成为苏格兰的守护圣人，以及从爱丁堡城堡到村庄礼堂，白色圣安德鲁十字架在蓝色背景上是如何被升起的。我们画了小型的圣安德鲁十字架旗，听了肯雅塔先生的简短风笛表演，还在学校咖啡馆尝了短面包饼和小燕麦饼。回到家，我在《大英百科全书儿童版》中阅读了格子图案和高地家族的相关信息，了解到家族曾经在山谷中通过赛跑来解决争端，并阅读了尼斯湖水怪的传说。那天晚上，我把一小块毡制的圣安德鲁十字架贴在我的卧室门上，戴上借来的格子围巾，一边喝着热的Irn-Bru，一边听BBC播放的《苏格兰之花》——安静却充满活力，这让我感觉自己真正参与了一段苏格兰的遗产。

questions.question_en: What is your favorite memory from last Christmas Holidays, and how do you plan to make new memories this year?
questions.question_ch: 你去年圣诞假期最喜欢的回忆是什么？你打算如何在今年创造新的回忆？
questions.answer_en: My favorite memory from last Christmas was waking up at Grandma and Grandpa’s cottage in the Cotswolds to find the lace shawl my great-grandmother Orla had knitted draped over the fireplace, the smell of roast lamb and chestnuts drifting through the room as our whole family gathered around a small Christmas tree laden with presents—especially the moment Aunt Audrey handed me a Switch to unwrap, and we spent the afternoon laughing over hot cocoa and new games. This year I plan to make new memories by inviting Chen Jia and Leslie to a gingerbread-making afternoon at our house, crafting homemade ornaments for the tree, then heading out for a brisk winter walk in Hampstead Heath to watch birds and maybe spot a red kite, before warming up with hot lamb pao mo that I’ll prepare myself, blending family traditions with the new customs I’ve learned from friends.
questions.answer_ch: 我去年圣诞节最喜欢的回忆是在科茨沃尔德的祖父母小屋醒来，看到我曾祖母奥拉编织的蕾丝披肩披在壁炉上，烤羊肉和栗子的香味飘散在房间里，整个家族围绕着一棵装满礼物的小圣诞树聚集——特别是当奥黛丽姑姑把一个Switch递给我拆包裹的那一刻，我们在热可可和新游戏中度过了欢笑的下午。今年我计划通过邀请陈佳和莱斯利来我家制作姜饼来创造新的回忆，给圣诞树制作自制装饰品，然后去汉普斯特德希斯散步，观察鸟类，可能还会看到红鹫，最后用我自己准备的热羊肉泡馍来暖身，把家族传统和我从朋友那里学到的新习俗结合在一起。

questions.question_en: How does your family celebrate Christmas Day and Boxing Day—special meals, gifts, or visiting relatives?
questions.question_ch: 你的家人是如何庆祝圣诞节和节礼日的——特别的餐食、礼物或探望亲戚？
questions.answer_en: On Christmas morning I tumbled downstairs to find my stocking bulging with little treats Mum had carefully chosen the night before; we then piled into the car and drove out to Granny and Grandad’s in the Cotswolds, where Aunt Audrey and her partner joined us. In Grandma’s warm kitchen we roasted turkey with all the trimmings—pigs in blankets, roast potatoes crisped in goose fat, honey-glazed parsnips—and finished with Christmas pudding aflame with brandy. After lunch we exchanged our main presents—my Switch from Aunt Audrey, her homemade marmalade from Mum, and Dad’s new book set—before spending the afternoon playing board games in front of the fire. On Boxing Day we woke late, ate turkey sandwiches and mince-pie muffins, then visited my other grandparents closer to home for a more informal feast of cold meats and salads; Dad and I went for a bracing walk on the heath while Mum and Lucy helped clear up, and in the evening we curled up to watch Doctor Who together, sharing small gifts and planning New Year’s adventures.
questions.answer_ch: 圣诞节早晨，我跌跌撞撞地跑下楼，发现我的圣诞袜塞满了妈妈前一天晚上精心挑选的小礼物；然后我们挤进车里，开车去科茨沃尔德的奶奶和爷爷家，阿姨奥德丽和她的伴侣也加入了我们。在奶奶温暖的厨房里，我们烤了火鸡，配上所有的配菜——裹着培根的小香肠、用鹅油煎得酥脆的烤土豆、蜂蜜 glazed 的欧防根——最后以浸泡在白兰地中的圣诞布丁结束。午餐后，我们交换了主要的礼物——我从阿姨奥德丽那里获赠了Switch，妈妈送了她自制的橘子酱，爸爸则是一本新书套装——然后花了一个下午在火炉前玩桌面游戏。节礼日那天，我们睡得很晚，吃了火鸡三明治和馅饼松饼，然后去探望住得更近的另一个祖父母，享受了一顿更随意的冷肉和沙拉盛宴；爸爸和我在荒原上散步，妈妈和露西则帮忙收拾，晚上的时候，我们蜷缩在一起观看《神秘博士》，分享小礼物并计划新年的冒险。

questions.question_en: When Dad takes you and Luthien to your paternal grandparents’ house, what do you look forward to doing in the suburbs?
questions.question_ch: 当爸爸带你和露西恩去祖父母家时，你期待在郊区做些什么？
questions.answer_en: Whenever Dad drives Luthien and me out to Grandma and Grandpa’s suburban home I get butterflies imagining all the little adventures ahead.  I can’t wait to trot down their long garden path, peering into the fish tank to watch the guppies and angelfish dart among the plants, then tiptoe over to feed Colonel Rock the turtle fresh lettuce.  I love clapping my hands to coax Leopard and Cleopatra the geckos out from under their rocks and giggling as Cotton-tail and I share carrot sticks on the lawn.  I’ll bring my notebook to sketch the bright yellow parrots and watch beetles explore the flowerbeds.  Every time I’m there I beg Grandma to let me snip a few roses for my room and help Grandpa pull up weeds in his vegetable patch so we can taste the first tomatoes.  And of course the best moment is gathering at their big oak table for Sunday roast—Grandpa’s lamb soup, Grandma’s steamed greens and the crackling potato roast—they somehow taste even better in the fresh country air.  Those afternoons are pure magic.
questions.answer_ch: 每当爸爸带着露西恩和我驶向外婆外公的郊区家时，我就会因为想象即将到来的小冒险而感到兴奋不已。我迫不及待想要跑下他们那条长长的花园小径，偷望鱼缸，观看小鱼和天使鱼在植物间游动，然后轻轻走过去喂科罗纳尔·洛克这只乌龟新鲜的生菜。我喜欢拍手引导豹子和克利奥帕特拉这两只壁虎从石头下爬出来，和棉尾兔一起在草坪上分享胡萝卜棒时我忍不住咯咯笑。我会带上我的笔记本去素描明亮的黄色鹦鹉，观察甲虫在花坛中探索。每次我在那儿，我都会请求外婆让我剪几朵玫瑰带回我的房间，还帮外公拔掉蔬菜园里的杂草，这样我们就能品尝到第一批番茄。当然，最美好的时刻是全家聚在他们的大橡木桌旁享用周日的烤肉——外公的羊肉汤、外婆的蒸青菜和香脆的土豆烤肉——在清新的乡村空气中品尝，似乎味道更加美妙。那些午后简直就是魔法般的存在。

questions.question_en: How do you spend Sundays with Dad while Mom works and takes Luthien—do you have a special activity or treat together?
questions.question_ch: 你们在妈妈工作、带着露西恩的时候，如何和爸爸一起度过星期天？你们有特别的活动或欢愉吗？
questions.answer_en: On those Sundays when Mum’s at work with Luthien, Dad and I have what we call our “weekend adventure.” We usually rise early, pack binoculars, sketchbooks and a thermos of hot chocolate, and head for either Hampstead Heath or Kew Gardens. I spend the walk talking Dad’s ear off about whatever new insect or bird I’ve spotted that week, and he listens, occasionally pointing out a tuft of feathers or a curious beetle. After a good hour of cloud-watching or butterfly-chasing, we’ll find a little café or tearoom—maybe the one near the zoo—for scones and Devonshire cream, and Dad always lets me pick the jam. Sometimes, if the weather’s right, we detour to fly a kite on Parliament Hill. Other weekends we’ll wander into the Natural History Museum to see the ichthyosaur—or try a streetside cooking class together, experimenting with pancakes or even a new soup recipe. It’s our one-on-one time: a mix of fresh air, small treats and serious chats, and I always end up looking forward to those Sundays more than anything.
questions.answer_ch: 在那些妈妈和卢西恩一起工作的星期天，爸爸和我会进行我们所称的“周末冒险”。我们通常早起，带上望远镜、素描本和一壶热巧克力，前往汉普斯特德荒原或凯尤花园。我会在路上跟爸爸喋喋不休地聊这周我发现的新昆虫或鸟类，而他偶尔会指着一绺羽毛或一只好奇的甲虫。在好好地云观或追逐蝴蝶一个小时后，我们会找到一家小咖啡馆或茶室——也许是动物园附近的那家——享用干糕和德文奶油，而爸爸总是让我选择果酱。有时，如果天气合适，我们会绕路去国会山放风筝。在其他周末，我们会漫步到自然历史博物馆去看鱼龙，或者一起尝试街边的烹饪课，实验煎饼甚至新汤的食谱。这是我们的独处时间：新鲜空气、小零食和严肃对话的结合，而我总是期待那些星期天胜过其他任何事情。

questions.question_en: What does Dad like to do when he spends Saturday alone, and how do you look forward to hearing about it on Sunday?
questions.question_ch: 爸爸在独自度过周六时喜欢做什么，你期待在周日听到有关这件事的消息吗？
questions.answer_en: Dad’s “day alone” Saturdays are his chance to feed his passions—whether it’s slipping off to Wimbledon in summer to watch tennis, losing himself in a new art-gallery show, or wandering the Natural History Museum’s fossil halls. Sometimes he’ll spend the morning at a quiet café with a book or explore Hampstead Heath on a long walk, binoculars slung over his shoulder. Then on Sunday afternoon, when he pops round to pick us up, I can’t wait to hear every detail. I’ll lean against the doorframe hungry for his stories—who won that tie-break, which painting took his breath away, what new discovery he made—all of it makes me feel like I was right there beside him.
questions.answer_ch: 爸爸的“独处日”星期六是他追寻激情的机会——无论是夏天溜去温布尔登看网球，沉浸在新的艺术画廊展览中，还是在自然历史博物馆的化石大厅漫步。有时，他会在一个安静的咖啡馆里读书度过上午，或者在汉普斯特德荒原上长时间散步，肩上背着望远镜。然后在星期日下午，他过来接我们时，我迫不及待想听到每一个细节。我会靠在门框上，渴望听他的故事——谁赢得了那个决胜局，哪个画作让他屏息，他发现了什么新奇的事物——所有这些都让我觉得我仿佛就在他身边。

questions.question_en: How do Mom and Dad plan their date day, and what is your favorite memory of picking up the kids from your maternal grandparents?
questions.question_ch: 妈妈和爸爸是如何计划约会日的，你最喜欢从外婆外公那里接孩子的回忆是什么？
questions.answer_en: Mom and Dad never leave their date day to chance.  A week ahead they agree which Sunday it will be, usually the second of the month, then Dad books a table at a cosy restaurant, Mom chooses a new film for the cinema and they arrange with Grandma Mary and Grandpa Lucas to look after Lucy and me all afternoon.  On the morning of the date they drop us at our grandparents’ house in the Cotswolds, kissing us goodbye over Mum’s freshly brewed tea and Grandpa’s warm scones, then slip away for their day together.  My favourite memory of being picked up is from last winter: Mum and Dad arrived just as dusk settled, the snow softly sparkling on the hedges, and Grandpa stood by the front gate, his arms full of wool blankets.  Lucy and I ran into their waiting arms, the smell of pine wreaths and Sunday roast still warm in the car, and Mum tucked fresh pastries into our laps for the drive home.  It felt like coming home to a storybook every time.
questions.answer_ch: 妈妈和爸爸从不把约会日留给偶然。提前一周，他们商定好是哪一个星期天，通常是这个月的第二个星期天，然后爸爸在一家舒适的餐厅预定一桌，妈妈选择一部新电影去电影院，接着他们和玛丽奶奶以及卢卡斯爷爷安排好，让他们整个下午照顾露西和我。在约会日的早晨，他们把我们送到外祖父母位于科茨沃尔德的家，在妈妈泡好的新茶和爷爷温暖的烤饼上亲吻我们告别，随后便甜蜜地离开去享受他们的时光。我最喜欢的被接走的回忆是去年冬天：妈妈和爸爸在黄昏降临时到达，雪在树篱上轻轻闪烁，爷爷站在前门口，怀里抱满了毛毯。露西和我跑进他们等待的怀抱，车里弥漫着松树花环和星期天烤肉的温暖气息，妈妈还在我们腿上放了新鲜的糕点，准备回家的路。每一次都感觉像回到故事书里一样。

questions.question_en: What game or project do you enjoy doing with Dad and Luthien when Mom works on week 3 Saturdays?
questions.question_ch: 你喜欢在妈妈的第三个星期六工作时和爸爸和Luthien一起做什么游戏或项目？
questions.answer_en: On those Saturdays Mom works, Dad takes Luthien and me to Uncle Irvin’s art studio, where we turn my special corner into a make-anything workshop—mixing paints for wild splatter canvases, molding clay or yarn into sculptures and flowers, and experimenting with any found materials we can grab, laughing as we discover new textures and colors together.
questions.answer_ch: 在妈妈工作的那个星期六，爸爸带着露西恩和我去厄尔文叔叔的艺术工作室，在那里我们把我特别的角落变成一个随意创作的工作坊——混合颜料做出疯狂的飞溅画，捏泥土或纱线做成雕塑和花朵，尝试任何我们能找到的材料，一边欢笑着一起发现新纹理和颜色。

questions.question_en: When Mom takes Luthien and you stay with Dad, what is your favorite activity to share with him on those Sundays?
questions.question_ch: 当妈妈带着卢西恩，你和爸爸呆在一起时，你最喜欢在那些周日与他分享什么活动？
questions.answer_en: My favorite Sunday with Dad is heading out after breakfast to Hampstead Heath with my binoculars.  We stroll the wide paths beneath the trees, hunting woodpeckers or the occasional red kite, stopping on a bench to share a flask of hot tea and a sandwich I’ve made.  Those quiet hours, just the two of us scanning the sky and talking about everything from clouds to constellations, are the best part of my week.
questions.answer_ch: 我最喜欢的星期天就是早餐后和爸爸一起带着望远镜去汉普斯特德公园。我们在树下的宽阔小道上漫步，寻找啄木鸟或偶尔出现的红鸢，停在长椅上分享一壶热茶和我准备的三明治。那段安静的时光，只有我们两个人扫描天空，聊着从云彩到星座的各种话题，是我一周中最美好的时光。

questions.question_en: What is your favorite dish at the end-of-month Sunday roast with maternal grandparents, and who usually carves the meat?
questions.question_ch: 你最喜欢的月底周日烤肉菜肴是什么，通常是谁来切肉？
questions.answer_en: My very favorite part of our end-of-month Sunday roast at Grandma Mary and Grandpa William’s is always the roast lamb—its golden, herby crust and tender pink meat, served with mint sauce, crispy roast potatoes and a ladle of rich gravy. Grandpa William almost always takes on the honored task of carving the joint; he stands at the head of the table, knife in hand, and slices the lamb with careful deliberation, passing me the fattest, juiciest pieces first.
questions.answer_ch: 我最喜欢的部分是奶奶玛丽和爷爷威廉的月末星期日烤肉，总是烤羊肉——它金黄、芳香的外皮和嫩粉红的肉，配上薄荷酱、酥脆的烤土豆和浓郁的肉汁。爷爷威廉几乎总是承担着切肉的光荣任务；他站在桌子首位，手握刀，仔细地切割羊肉，优先给我传递最肥美、最多汁的部分。

questions.question_en: Which subject do you find most engaging on Mondays, and how does PSHE help you at the end of the day?
questions.question_ch: 你觉得星期一哪个科目最吸引人，PSHE 在一天结束时如何帮助你？
questions.answer_en: On Mondays I find science the most engaging because we get to run experiments in our lab corner—last week we tested how plants taste different solutions and I loved watching the tiny bubbles form when we added baking soda to vinegar under the microscope; it feels like discovering a hidden world every time I don my goggles and gloves. PSHE at the end of the day helps me unwind by giving me space to talk about how I feel, learn ways to manage worries and to understand other people’s perspectives, so by the time I leave school I’m not just buzzing from science but also calmer, clearer and ready to go home with a plan for any worries that popped up during the day.
questions.answer_ch: 在星期一，我发现科学最吸引人，因为我们可以在实验室角落进行实验——上周我们测试了植物如何品尝不同的溶液，我喜欢在显微镜下观察我们向醋中加入小苏打时形成的微小气泡；每次我戴上护目镜和手套时，就像在发现一个隐藏的世界。课后生活教育让我放松，因为我有空间谈论我的感受，学习管理烦恼的方法，并理解他人的观点，因此当我离开学校时，我不仅是因为科学而兴奋，还更加平静、清晰，并准备好带着解决日间烦恼的计划回家。

questions.question_en: How do you feel switching from DT to DT in the last two periods—what kinds of design tasks do you enjoy most?
questions.question_ch: 你感觉在最后两个阶段从设计技术转到设计技术如何——你最喜欢什么样的设计任务？
questions.answer_en: I actually love how those back-to-back DT lessons feel like two chances each week to dive deeper into making something real: my mind flips from sketching ideas to grabbing tools and materials in a matter of seconds so it never grows dull. The design tasks I enjoy most are the ones that let me invent my own little gadgets or models—whether that’s crafting a kite frame from balsa wood and string, building a tiny soap-mold prototype with coffee grounds and herbs, or assembling a cardboard mock-up of a Rube Goldberg machine. I get a real buzz from choosing my own materials, testing how things fit and move, and then watching classmates’ faces light up when they see my creations work. It’s this hands-on problem solving—figuring out what goes wrong, tweaking my design, then making it click—that makes DT feel like the best part of my school day.
questions.answer_ch: 我真的很喜欢那些连着的设计与科技课，它们让我每周都有两次机会更深入地去创造一些真实的东西：我的思维从绘制想法到迅速抓取工具和材料，几秒钟内就能转换，所以它从不 dull。我最喜欢的设计任务是那些让我可以发明自己的小玩意儿或模型的任务——无论是用轻木和线制作风筝框架，还是用咖啡渣和草药制作微型肥皂模原型，或是组装一个纸板的鲁布·戈德堡机器模型。选择自己的材料、测试物品的配合和移动，然后看到同学们的脸在我的创作运作时闪光，我真的感到很兴奋。这种动手解决问题的过程——弄清楚出错的地方，调整我的设计，然后让它运行起来——使得DT课成为我学校生活中最精彩的部分。

questions.question_en: What do you like most about swimming on Wednesdays, and how do you prepare yourself for those sessions?
questions.question_ch: 你最喜欢星期三游泳的什么，如何为这些课程做准备？
questions.answer_en: What I like most about swimming on Wednesdays is that the moment I slide into the cool, quiet water I feel weightless, as if I’ve left all my worries on the poolside. The gentle rhythm of my arms stroking, the steady beat of my heart underwater and the echo of my breath make everything else disappear, and I love that feeling of calm and strength growing with every lap. To prepare I always pack my swim bag the night before: my favorite blue goggles, a snug swim‐cap, a towel, and a small snack—usually a slice of whole-wheat toast with orange marmalade—for energy afterward. In the morning I eat a good breakfast, gather my things, and leave a little early so I can stretch in the changing room, shake out any stiffness and remind myself of my strokes. By the time I dive in on Wednesday, my body and mind are ready to glide.
questions.answer_ch: 我最喜欢周三游泳的原因是，当我滑入凉爽宁静的水中时，感觉无比轻盈，仿佛所有的烦恼都留在了池边。手臂轻柔划水的节奏、心脏在水下稳定的跳动以及呼吸的回音让其他一切都消失，我喜欢在每一圈中越来越强烈的平静和力量感。为了准备，我总是在前一天晚上把游泳包打好：我最喜欢的蓝色护目镜、一顶紧身泳帽、一条毛巾和一小份零食——通常是一片全麦吐司涂橙子果酱，以便之后补充能量。早上我吃一顿丰盛的早餐，收拾好东西，稍提早出发，以便在更衣室里拉伸一下，甩掉身体的僵硬，提醒自己游泳的动作。当我在周三跳入水中时，我的身体和心态已经准备好畅游了。

questions.question_en: How do you balance studying Religion and PE on Thursdays, and which one energizes you more?
questions.question_ch: 你如何平衡星期四的宗教与体育课，哪个让你更有活力？
questions.answer_en: On Thursdays I start with Religion just after lunch, so I come into class with a calm mind by jotting down the stories and questions swirling in my head, asking our teacher about different faiths and symbols, and really focusing on what those ancient parables mean today; then, as soon as the bell for PE rings I swap my school shoes for trainers and dash out to the field, racing around, kicking balls or trying out new hurdles. Balancing the two means using Religion to centre my thoughts and slow my breath, and then using PE to shake off any mental cobwebs and fill my body with energy—between the two, it’s definitely PE that makes me feel most alive, sending endorphins through my legs and turning every muscle into a cheerful buzz.
questions.answer_ch: 在星期四，我在午餐后开始上宗教课，因此我会在课堂上以平静的心态进入，写下脑海中涌现的故事和问题，询问老师关于不同信仰和符号的内容，认真思考这些古老寓言在今天的意义；接着，一响起体育课的铃声，我就换上运动鞋，迅速冲出去奔向操场，四处奔跑、踢球或尝试新的障碍。平衡这两者意味着利用宗教来集中我的思绪和缓慢我的呼吸，然后利用体育课来驱散任何心理上的迷雾，为我的身体注入能量——在这两者之间，毫无疑问是体育课让我感到最有生气，让内啡肽在我的腿部流动，让每一块肌肉都充满了愉悦的感觉。

questions.question_en: What drama activity do you look forward to on Fridays, and how does it help you wind down before the weekend?
questions.question_ch: 你期待周五的哪种戏剧活动，这对你在周末之前放松有什么帮助？
questions.answer_en: On Fridays I most look forward to our drama class with Ms. Yang, when the classroom transforms into a little stage and we get to improvise short scenes and build simple props and costumes from scratch. We might pretend to be explorers in a jungle, knights defending a castle or even gossiping cats in a family of mice—nothing is too silly. I love the way we all burst into laughter as we try out our wildest ideas and see them tumble into farcical reality. After a long week of lessons and tests, those forty minutes of creating and performing let me forget about homework and classroom rules. My legs and hands feel lighter as I dash about in a pirate’s hat or wave a cardboard sword, and by the end I’m buzzing with joy and ready to slide into the weekend with a big smile.
questions.answer_ch: 在星期五，我最期待的是和杨老师的戏剧课，教室变成了一个小舞台，我们可以即兴表演短剧，并从零开始制作简单的道具和服装。我们可能假装是丛林中的探险者，捍卫城堡的骑士，或者甚至是一家老鼠中的闲聊猫——没有什么是太傻的。我喜欢我们大家在尝试各种疯狂点子时爆发出笑声，看到它们变成滑稽的现实。经过一周的课程和考试，那四十分钟的创造和表演让我忘记了家庭作业和课堂规则。当我在海盗帽子里飞奔，或挥舞着纸板剑时，手脚都感觉轻松起来，最后我充满了快乐，准备带着大大的微笑滑入周末。

questions.question_en: How did you enjoy the campus-wide Art Gallery Visit on Tuesdays in Version 2, and what was your favorite piece?
questions.question_ch: 您如何评价在第二版中每周二的校园艺术画廊参观，您最喜欢的作品是什么？
questions.answer_en: I loved those Tuesday gallery visits – as soon as the bell rang for periods six and seven I’d race down the corridor, notebook in hand, and lose myself among the dozens of works on display. The diversity was thrilling: watercolors of misty marshes, bold abstract sculptures, delicate clay reliefs, even a student’s animated short looping on a tablet. But my favorite piece was the enormous mixed-media “Tree of Time” by Ms Phyllis Yang—a cross-section of an ancient oak painted in deep browns and metallic gold leaf that caught the light just so. I stood in front of it longer than anywhere else, tracing the concentric rings with my eyes, imagining each ring as a chapter of Earth’s story. It felt, somehow, like the world itself had been paused for me to study.
questions.answer_ch: 我爱那些星期二的画廊参观——每当第六和第七节的铃声响起，我就会手握笔记本迅速奔向走廊，沉浸在展出的数十件作品中。多样性令人兴奋：水彩画描绘着朦胧的沼泽，大胆的抽象雕塑，精致的陶泥浮雕，甚至还有一名学生的动画短片在平板上循环播放。但我最喜欢的作品是Ms Phyllis Yang创作的巨大混合媒体作品《时间之树》——一段古老橡树的横截面，油漆成深棕色，镶嵌了反射光线的金属箔。我在它面前停留的时间比在其他地方都要长，眼睛沿着同心圆移动，想象每一个圈都是地球故事的一章。这种感觉，仿佛整个世界都为我暂停下来以便我研究。

questions.question_en: What was memorable about the Art Gallery Visit compared to regular Computer or Science lessons?
questions.question_ch: 与普通的计算机或科学课相比，参观艺术画廊有什么令人难忘的地方？
questions.answer_en: What I remember most about the Art Gallery Visit is how different it felt from sitting at a computer or doing a science experiment. Instead of screens or microscopes, I was surrounded by giant paintings and sculptures I could wander around and really study—every brushstroke and color felt alive. The hush of the gallery, the way the light played across the walls, even the smell of old wood floors made me feel like I’d stepped inside someone’s imagination. In computer class we learn to type and click through code, and in science lessons we follow precise steps to test or measure things, but in the gallery I sketched ideas on the spot, let my eyes drift over shapes and details, and felt my own ideas bubbling up. It was sensory and reflective in a way no lab or keyboard ever is—walking through grown-up art made me want to try new materials and trust my own creativity more than I ever had before.
questions.answer_ch: 我对参观美术馆最深刻的记忆，是那种与坐在电脑前或做科学实验截然不同的感觉。没有屏幕或显微镜，我被巨大的画作和雕塑包围，可以在其中漫步，真正地细细观赏——每一笔触、每一种色彩都仿佛鲜活起来。美术馆的寂静、光线在墙面上的流动，甚至旧木地板的气味，都让我有一种走进某人想象世界的感觉。在计算机课上，我们学习打字和点击代码；在科学课上，我们按照精确步骤进行测试或测量；但在美术馆里，我当场速写，眼睛在形状和细节间游移，自己的创意也随之涌现。这种体验在任何实验室或键盘前都无法比拟——在成人的艺术世界中漫步，让我想尝试新材料，也让我比以往任何时候都更相信自己的创造力。

questions.question_en: How does studying Music on Wednesdays affect your mood for the PE session afterward?
questions.question_ch: 在星期三学习音乐会如何影响你之后参加体育课时的心情？
questions.answer_en: On Wednesdays I always arrive at PE feeling oddly brighter than usual. Monica’s music class lifts my spirits—whether we’re clapping out a reggae beat or exploring world rhythms, I leave with my feet itching to move and a smile on my face. That leftover buzz from singing or dancing carries straight into warm-ups: I sprint with more confidence, my arms swing with extra gusto, and I’m far more willing to try new games or catch a ball I’d normally let roll by. In short, a good dose of music on Wednesdays turns PE into one big, joyful adventure.
questions.answer_ch: 每到星期三，我参加体育课时总觉得心情特别明亮。莫妮卡的音乐课让人精神振奋——无论是打拍子演奏雷鬼节奏，还是探索世界节奏，我总是带着跃动的脚步和灿烂的笑容离开。唱歌或跳舞后剩下的余兴直接带进热身环节：我跑得更自信，手臂摆动更有力，对尝试新游戏或抓住那颗原本会让它滚过去的球也更感兴趣。总之，每到星期三的音乐课都让体育课变成一次欢乐的大冒险。

questions.question_en: What project did you create during Photography (or Music) class on Thursdays, and who helped you the most?
questions.question_ch: 在星期四的摄影（或音乐）课上，你创作了什么项目？谁最帮助了你？
questions.answer_en: In our Thursday music class I led a small ensemble in composing and performing an original reggae-inspired piece—melding hand-claps, simple xylophone riffs and improvised cajón beats—and Ms Monica Kenyatta helped me the most by patiently teaching me how to lock into the off-beat rhythm and encouraging me whenever I lost my timing.
questions.answer_ch: 在我们周四的音乐课上，我带领了一个小型合奏团创作并演奏了一首原创的雷鬼风格曲目——融合了击掌、简单的木琴即兴乐句和即兴卡洪鼓节奏——莫妮卡·肯雅塔女士给予了我最大的帮助，她耐心教我如何把握切分节奏，并在我走拍时不断鼓励我。

questions.question_en: What do you enjoy drawing or painting during the Painting/Sculpture periods on Fridays, and how do you display your finished work?
questions.question_ch: 在周五的绘画/雕塑时段，你喜欢画或描绘什么？你如何展示完成的作品？
questions.answer_en: On Fridays during Painting & Sculpture I most love sketching the tiny worlds I see in the park—detailed studies of beetles’ armor, fluttering butterflies, the ripples around a drinking sparrow—then adding washes of color to bring their patterns and habitats alive. Sometimes I’ll shape small clay models of my favorite insects or carve reliefs of owl faces in plaster. When a piece is finished I carry it home to pin or hang it in my “gallery” corner: a corkboard above my desk or along the stairwell wall where each family member can discover new works. Occasionally I’ll offer a favorite drawing to my little sister’s room or stick a sculpture on Uncle Owen’s shelf. At school our class curator hangs select pieces in the corridor display case for the monthly Art Week exhibition so everyone can see what I’ve been up to.
questions.answer_ch: 在周五的绘画与雕塑课上，我最喜欢在公园里速写那些微小的世界——详尽描绘甲虫的盔甲、振翅的蝴蝶、饮水麻雀周围的涟漪——然后再用淡彩渲染，让它们的纹理和栖息环境栩栩如生。有时我还会捏制自己最喜欢的昆虫小陶塑，或在石膏上雕刻猫头鹰脸的浮雕。作品完成后，我会把它带回家，别在我的“画廊”角落：桌子上方的软木板或楼梯墙壁，让家人随时发现我的新作。偶尔，我会把自己钟爱的画作送到妹妹的房间，或把一件雕塑摆到欧文叔叔的书架上。在学校，我们班的策展人会挑选作品挂在走廊的展柜里，为每月的艺术周展览做展示，让大家都能看到我的创作。

questions.question_en: What is the first thought that crosses your mind when your alarm sounds at 7:00?
questions.question_ch: 当你的闹钟在7:00响起时，你脑海中最先浮现的想法是什么？
questions.answer_en: The instant I hear the alarm at 7:00, my head snaps up and I think: it’s time to get up, check on Colonel Rock and my geckos, then race to the kitchen to whip up whole-wheat toast with Bonne Maman marmalade before Dad strolls in for breakfast.
questions.answer_ch: 一听到七点的闹钟响，我立刻抬头，心想：该起床了，去看看洛克上校和我的壁虎们，然后冲到厨房，在爸爸悠闲地走进来吃早餐前，赶紧做全麦吐司配Bonne Maman果酱。

questions.question_en: How do you decide what to have for breakfast, and who helps you prepare it during this time?
questions.question_ch: 你如何决定早餐吃什么？在这个过程中谁会帮助你准备？
questions.answer_en: I usually decide my breakfast the night before by surveying what’s in the kitchen and what I’m eager to try next—sometimes toast with Bonne Maman marmalade, other times a sunny‐side-up egg or a fresh batch of whole‐wheat pancakes. Ever since I turned six Mum gave me sole responsibility for breakfast, so I pick a recipe that fits my mood and the ingredients we have. Most mornings I craft whole-wheat toast, medium-baked, topped with marmalade, or I fry an egg after practicing my technique. Mum joins me if I’m tackling something tricky—like when I first burned my finger making eggs—and offers guidance on heat and timing. Dad often stops by with a taste test, reminds me to use the stovetop safely, or pitches in with pancakes on weekends. This way breakfast becomes my own little cooking adventure, planned and prepared by me, with Mum and Dad as my friendly sous-chefs.
questions.answer_ch: 我通常在前一晚决定第二天的早餐：先看看厨房里有什么，再根据想尝试的新口味来定——有时来片抹着Bonne Maman果酱的吐司，有时做一枚煎得恰到好处的太阳蛋，或者一份新鲜出锅的全麦松饼。自从我六岁那年开始，妈妈就把早餐的全部责任交给我，所以我会根据心情和现有食材选个食谱。大多数早晨，我会把全麦面包烤到中等火候，抹上果酱；或者练习过我的煎蛋技巧后自己煎个蛋。遇到比较难的环节，比如刚开始做蛋时烫伤手指，妈妈就会来帮忙，告诉我火候和时间的掌控。爸爸也经常过来试尝，提醒我炉灶安全，周末的话还会一起来做松饼。这样早餐就成了我自己的烹饪小冒险，由我策划和准备，妈妈爸爸则是我亲切的助厨。

questions.question_en: During the time you wash, eat, dress, and pack, what part do you enjoy most, and what helps you stay on schedule?
questions.question_ch: 在你洗漱、吃饭、穿衣和打包的过程中，你最享受哪个环节？是什么帮助你保持按时进行？
questions.answer_en: I enjoy breakfast preparation most of all—from spreading the Bonne Maman marmalade on whole-wheat toast to sipping tea—it’s the one moment I really get to be in charge and experiment with flavors. What helps me stay on schedule is my little morning routine checklist: I set an alarm at 7 a.m., then tick off “wash,” “dress,” “eat,” and “pack” on the list I drew last night. Seeing each task crossed off on the fridge chart, and Dad’s gentle reminders (“Five minutes till we leave!”), keeps me focused so I’m never late—even when I dawdle over my toast.
questions.answer_ch: 我最喜欢准备早餐——从把Bonne Maman果酱涂在全麦吐司上到品一口茶——这是唯一一个真正由我掌控并能大胆尝试各种风味的时刻。让我保持准时的是那份早晨例行清单：我把闹钟设在早上七点，然后在昨晚画好的清单上依次勾掉“洗漱”“穿衣”“吃饭”和“收拾”这几项。看到冰箱上的任务一项项被划掉，再加上爸爸温柔的提醒（“五分钟后出发！”），让我始终专注，从不迟到——即使我在吐司前磨蹭也没关系。

questions.question_en: What do you and Dad talk about as you walk to school, and how does that help you start your day?
questions.question_ch: 你和爸爸在上学的路上聊些什么？这怎样帮助你开始新的一天？
questions.answer_en: Dad and I usually chat about everything we’re excited to learn that day—sometimes he’ll quiz me on a Latin botanical name or describe a curious bird sighting from his café break, other times I’ll tell him about a puzzle I solved or an insect I hope to spot at recess—and those conversations quietly prime my mind for school by turning the walk into our own little classroom, letting me ease into the day with curiosity instead of nerves, reminding me I’m never alone in asking questions and that each lesson is just another adventure we’ll talk about on the way home.
questions.answer_ch: 我和爸爸通常会聊当天我们最期待学习的事情——有时他会考我拉丁植物学名，或描述他在咖啡馆休息时看到的奇怪鸟类；有时我会告诉他我解开了什么谜题，或在课间想要发现哪种昆虫——这些谈话悄悄为我的学习做了准备，把上学的路变成我们的小课堂，让我带着好奇心而不是紧张情绪轻松开始一天，也让我记得自己在提问时从不孤单，每节课都是我们回家路上会再聊的另一次冒险。

questions.question_en: Which part of your daily classes—Language, History, Geography, or Science—do you find most challenging, and why?
questions.question_ch: 你觉得在日常课程中——语言、历史、地理还是科学——哪一门最具挑战性？为什么？
questions.answer_en: I found History the most challenging. Despite my love for stories, I struggled to keep all the dates, names and events in the right order—my mind felt like a jumble of kings, wars and revolutions. I wanted to explore why societies changed and what life felt like for people back then, but instead I ended up spending hours memorizing facts and timelines. Science experiments excited me and Geography let me map the world around me, but History demanded I store endless details in my head, and that made it the hardest subject for me.
questions.answer_ch: 我觉得历史是最具挑战性的学科。尽管我喜欢故事，但我很难把所有的日期、名字和事件都按正确顺序记住——我的脑海仿佛成了一团国王、战争和革命的混乱。我想探索为什么社会会发生变化，以及当时人们的生活感受，却最后花了好几个小时背诵事实和时间线。科学实验让我兴奋，地理让我可以绘制周围的世界，但历史却要求我在脑海中存储无尽的细节，这也使它成为我最难的学科。

questions.question_en: How do you feel when school ends at 15:40, and what is the first thing you look forward to doing afterward?
questions.question_ch: 当学校在15:40结束时，你有何感受？之后，你最期待做的第一件事是什么？
questions.answer_en: When the clock finally strikes 15:40 and school’s out, I feel a rush of relief and excitement—as if a little balloon inside me just popped.  The very first thing I look forward to is slipping down to the café with Dad for our afternoon tea and soda crackers, that warm, quiet moment when I can plan whether I’ll dash off to the insect club, peer through my binoculars in the park, or retreat to Owen’s studio to create.
questions.answer_ch: 当钟声终于敲响15:40，放学铃一响，我就松了一口气，又兴奋不已——仿佛体内有个小气球“砰”地一声爆开。我最期待的，就是和爸爸溜到咖啡馆喝下午茶、吃苏打饼干，那温暖而宁静的时刻，让我可以计划：是要飞奔去昆虫俱乐部，在公园用双筒望远镜观察，还是躲进欧文的工作室创作。

questions.question_en: What topics do you and Dad discuss over tea at the café, and how does that one-on-one time benefit you?
questions.question_ch: 你和爸爸在咖啡馆喝茶时讨论哪些话题？那段一对一的时光对你有什么帮助？
questions.answer_en: I usually met Dad for tea at our favorite café after school, and we talked about all sorts of things: my latest science experiments—like the ichthyosaur fossil or our soap-making trials—his memories of the Natural History Museum, the strange dreams I’d had about Great-Grandma Orla, the birds we’d spotted at Hampstead Heath, the puzzles in my maths homework, Dad’s favorite “Doctor Who” episodes and even big questions like why I’m alive or what makes clouds float. That one-on-one time helped me feel heard and understood, made it easier to ask any question, showed me how Dad thinks calmly through problems and built my confidence and curiosity as we explored ideas together.
questions.answer_ch: 放学后，我常去我们最喜欢的咖啡馆和爸爸喝下午茶，我们谈各种各样的事：我最近的科学实验——比如鱼龙化石或我们的自制肥皂测试——他在自然历史博物馆的回忆，我做了关于曾祖母奥拉的那些奇怪梦境，我们在汉普斯特德荒原看到的鸟类，我数学作业里的难题，爸爸最喜欢的《神秘博士》剧集，甚至还有一些大问题，比如我为什么活着，或者云朵为什么会飘浮。那段一对一的时光让我感到被倾听和理解，也让我更容易提出任何问题，让我看到了爸爸如何冷静地思考问题，并在一起探索想法的过程中培养了我的自信和好奇心。

questions.question_en: What do you like most about afternoon tea at school, and who do you sit with when you have it?
questions.question_ch: 你最喜欢学校下午茶的哪一点？喝下午茶时你通常和谁坐在一起？
questions.answer_en: I like that afternoon tea feels like a little holiday in the middle of a busy school day: the gentle clink of china, the smell of warm scones with clotted cream and strawberry jam, the chance to sip a cup of milky tea and taste a different kind of sandwich or biscuit. It gives me time to rest, chat about what we learned in class and share the small adventures of the day. On Tuesdays to Thursdays I sit with my best friend Gerald and Chen Jia at a long table in the hall—Gerald cracks jokes, Chen Jia shows me a new insect fact, and sometimes Leslie joins us too. Those twenty minutes are my favorite moment, a cozy pause before the afternoon’s activities begin.
questions.answer_ch: 我喜欢下午茶，因为在忙碌的上课日里，下午茶就像一个小小的假期：瓷器轻轻叮当作响，温热的司康饼散发着浓稠奶油和草莓酱的香气，捧一杯奶茶，尝尝不同样式的三明治或饼干。这让我有时间休息，聊聊课堂上学到的东西，分享当天的小冒险。周二到周四，我会和我最好的朋友Gerald以及陈佳一起坐在大厅长桌旁——Gerald会讲笑话，陈佳会给我展示新的昆虫小知识，有时Leslie也会加入我们。那二十分钟是我最喜欢的时光，是下午活动开始前的温馨小歇。

questions.question_en: How does having tea at home with Sophie on Fridays compare to having tea during the week at school?
questions.question_ch: 在周五在家里和索菲一起喝茶，与平日在学校喝茶相比，有何不同？
questions.answer_en: I noticed that my Friday teas at home with Sophie felt very different from my weekday teas at school. At school I’d pour a quick cup of tea into a paper cup, grab a biscuit and sit with my friends in the cold corridor before heading off to clubs—it was routine, noisy and always felt like part of the timetable. With Sophie on Fridays I sat at her cozy kitchen table, drinking from real mugs, nibbling her homemade scones and talking about things that mattered—her studies, my week, even her accident and how she felt afterward. It was calm, warm and unhurried, and I loved that Sophie, unlike classmates I chat with between lessons, always listened as if what I said really mattered. That quiet, grown-up conversation at home made tea time feel like a small, special celebration each week, rather than just another school break.
questions.answer_ch: 我注意到在家里和Sophie一起度过的周五喝茶时光，与我在学校的工作日喝茶体验截然不同。在学校，我会往纸杯里迅速倒一杯茶，拿块饼干，然后和朋友们坐在冰冷的走廊里，接着去参加社团——这是例行公事、嘈杂，而且总感觉它只是课表上的一部分。而在周五和Sophie在一起时，我坐在她舒适的厨房餐桌旁，用真正的茶杯喝茶，啃着她亲手做的司康饼，聊些重要的事情——她的学业、我的一周，甚至她的那次意外和之后的心情。那是一段平静、温暖且悠闲的时光，我喜欢Sophie不同于课间和同学们的随意寒暄，她总是认真倾听，仿佛我说的每一句话都很重要。那种安静、成熟的谈话，让每周的茶点时光都像一场小小的特别庆祝，而不仅仅是又一次学校里的课间休息。

questions.question_en: Which extracurricular activity—cooking, arts & crafts, or movie—do you choose most often, and what is your favorite memory from that session?
questions.question_ch: 在课外活动中，你最常选择哪一项——烹饪、手工艺还是电影？你最喜欢那次活动中的哪个回忆？
questions.answer_en: I almost always pick cooking, because to me it’s like doing a magic experiment you can actually taste. My favorite memory is from last month’s Art Week, when Dad, Mum, Chen Jia and I gathered in Grandpa’s kitchen at the crack of dawn to chop coriander, simmer rich lamb broth, tear flatbread and assemble dozens of lamb paomo. Then we wheeled it all to the school’s food market, set up our stall and watched classmates and teachers queue for our £1 bowls. Seeing their eyes light up at the first spoonful—and knowing I’d helped turn a family recipe into something everyone loved—made that cooking session absolutely unforgettable.
questions.answer_ch: 我几乎总是选择烹饪，因为对我来说这就像做一个可以实际品尝的魔法实验。我最喜欢的记忆是在上个月的艺术周，那时我和爸爸、妈妈、陈佳在黎明时分聚集在爷爷的厨房，切香菜、慢炖浓郁的羊肉汤、撕饼，一起准备了几十碗羊肉泡馍。然后我们推着手推车把它们带到学校的美食市集，摆好摊，看着同学和老师们排队购买我们一镑一碗的羊肉泡馍。看到他们在第一口时眼睛一亮——知道我帮忙把一个家传食谱变成了人人喜爱的美食——让那次烹饪体验绝对难以忘怀。

questions.question_en: When Mom or Dad picks you up at 17:30, what do you usually chat about on the way home?
questions.question_ch: 当妈妈或爸爸在17:30来接你时，你们通常在回家路上聊些什么？
questions.answer_en: On the walk home after Mom or Dad picks me up at 17:30, we usually start with the simple question, “How was your day?” and I jump right into the best part of the afternoon—anything from the butterfly I spotted in Hampstead Heath to the sketch I completed in Art Club or the science experiment I tried in the Insect Society. If it’s Mom, she’ll tell me about a tricky case at the clinic or a funny thing a patient said, and I’ll compare her day with mine, trading stories over who had the more surprising discovery. If it’s Dad, he wants all the details of my Chinese lesson—he’s proud when I use new Mandarin words—and he’ll share a snippet of his students’ latest essays or a cracking joke from his drama rehearsal. We always end up chatting about dinner—what I’ve cooked or what special dish he’s thinking of picking up—then Mum or Dad reminds me of any chores I need to tackle, and we make a plan to squeeze in a bit of sketching, baking, or an outdoor adventure before bedtime.
questions.answer_ch:
放学后，17:30爸妈来接我回家的路上，我们通常会先聊一个简单的问题：“你今天怎么样？”然后我就会迫不及待地讲述下午的精彩瞬间——可能是我在汉普斯特德荒野公园看到的蝴蝶、在美术社完成的素描，或者在昆虫学会做的科学实验。如果是妈妈接我，她会告诉我诊所里一个棘手的病例，或者哪个病人说了什么有趣的话，然后我会把她的经历和我的对比，互相比拼谁的发现更让人惊喜。如果是爸爸接我，他会要我详细说说中文课的内容——当我用上新的普通话词汇时，他会很骄傲——然后他会分享他学生最新论文的片段，或者剧团排练时听到的一个绝妙笑话。  
我们总会聊到晚饭——我做了什么菜，或者他打算带什么特色菜回家——然后妈妈或爸爸会提醒我需要完成的家务，我们再商量着在睡觉前挤出时间来画画、烘焙或者去户外探险。

questions.question_en: How do you help with dinner preparation at home, and what dish do you enjoy making most?
questions.question_ch: 你在家里如何帮助准备晚餐？你最喜欢做哪道菜？
questions.answer_en: I usually dive in right after school, pulling vegetables from the fridge for washing and chopping—bell peppers, carrots, spring onions—then measure spices into little bowls so Mom can just grab and stir. I set the table, fetch pots and ladles, stir the sauce while she browns meat and garlic, and wipe up spills. My favorite dish to make is lamb pao mo: I mix and knead the dough for the flatbread, tear it into pieces, and help cook the lamb in a fragrant broth with herbs; watching the bread soak up that rich soup always makes me proud.
questions.answer_ch: 我通常一放学就动手，从冰箱里拿出蔬菜来洗和切——甜椒、胡萝卜、葱——然后把各种香料称好放在小碗里，这样妈妈就可以直接拿来调味。我摆好餐具，取锅和汤勺，在她把肉和蒜煎成金黄时搅拌酱汁，并随时擦拭溢出的酱汁。我最喜欢做的菜是羊肉泡馍：我和面、揉面，把饼撕成小块，然后帮忙把羊肉放进加了香草的浓汤里煮；看着馍块吸满浓汤，总让我特别自豪。

questions.question_en: How does Mom’s arrival home change the atmosphere in the house, and what do you like to share with her first?
questions.question_ch: 妈妈回家后，家里的气氛发生了怎样的变化？你最想先和她分享什么？
questions.answer_en: When Mom walks in the door the whole house seems to breathe a sigh of relief—the late‐afternoon light softens, the chatter around the dinner table grows warmer and more animated and even Peter and Cotton‐tail perk up as if they know she’s home. I immediately want to tell her about the red kite I spotted this morning in Hampstead Heath—how it glided so low I could just make out its silvery wingbars through my 10× binoculars—and I rush to her side, nearly tripping over my own feet, to share every thrilling detail before the moment slips away.
questions.answer_ch: 当妈妈推门而入，全家仿佛都松了一口气——傍晚的余晖变得柔和，饭桌上的谈笑声更加温暖、生动，连彼得和棉尾兔都精神一振，好像知道她回来了。我立刻想告诉她我今天早上在汉普斯特德荒原看到的红风筝——它飞得那么低，通过我10倍望远镜都能隐约看见那道银色的翼条——我飞快跑到她身边，差点被自己绊倒，想在这一刻消逝之前，把所有激动人心的细节一一倾诉。

questions.question_en: What makes Friday takeout night special, and how do you decide which restaurant or cuisine to order?
questions.question_ch: 是什么让星期五的外卖之夜如此特别？你如何决定从哪家餐厅或选择哪种菜系？
questions.answer_en: Friday take-out night feels like the grand finale of the week—after five days of packed schedules, it’s our family’s well-earned reward and chance to relax together. Instead of Mom or Dad cooking in the kitchen, we all gather around the living-room table with boxes from our favorite restaurants, and there’s something thrilling about the rustle of packaging and that first whiff of whatever deliciousness awaits inside. Deciding what to order is a bit of a ritual too: sometimes Mom consults her “cuisine calendar,” where she notes which country we haven’t tried in a while—last month it was Japanese donburi, this month it might be Lebanese mezze—sometimes Dad insists on pizza because everyone’s energy is low and a cheeky slice is just the thing. I get a vote too; I’ll recommend masala curry chicken if I’ve been reading about spices all week. We talk through our choices—will this go well for leftovers? Have we perhaps over-ordered last time?—and then we set our “take-out compass” on the winner. The result is always the same: we end the school-work routine by sharing something new (or a trusty favorite), with zero cleanup and maximum joy.
questions.answer_ch: 周五的外卖之夜就像一周的压轴大戏——在五天紧凑的日程之后，这是我们全家当之无愧的奖励，也是一起放松的时刻。不再是爸妈在厨房忙活，我们围坐在客厅的桌子旁，面前摆着最爱餐厅的外卖盒。听着包装纸的沙沙声，一闻到那股美味的香气，就格外激动。决定点什么也是一种仪式感：有时候妈妈会翻她的“美食日历”，看看哪些国家料理好久没尝——上个月是日本饭盖饭，这个月可能是黎巴嫩小吃；有时候爸爸偏要吃披萨，因为大家都累了，一两片薄底披萨正合适。我也有发言权；如果我整周都在看香料的书，就会推荐马沙拉咖喱鸡。我们边聊边斟酌——这顿能留点明天当饭吗？上次是不是点多了？——然后就用“外卖指南针”锁定最终选择。结果总是一样：我们用新口味（或常备经典）为一周的学业和工作画上圆满句号，零清理、满满欢乐。

questions.question_en: During your personal time, what activity relaxes you the most—reading, drawing, or playing a game—and why?
questions.question_ch: 在你的私人时间里，哪项活动最能让你放松——阅读、画画还是玩游戏？为什么？
questions.answer_en: For me, nothing beats drawing when it comes to unwinding. When I sit down with paper and pencil, I feel the day’s worries melt away as my mind drifts into the shapes and colors I choose. Whether I’m sketching a leaf I saw on Hampstead Heath or experimenting with splashes of paint in my uncle’s studio, the act of creating puts me in a quiet, almost dreamlike state. My thoughts slow, my breathing steadies, and I lose all sense of time—just the feel of the pencil in my hand and the image growing on the page. It’s both a gentle escape and a way to pour out my ideas without words, and afterward I always feel refreshed, as if I’ve cleared my head and found a little more space for the next day’s adventures.
questions.answer_ch: 对我来说，放松身心没有什么比画画更有效。当我拿起纸和铅笔坐下来时，一天的烦恼便在我将注意力投入所选的形状和颜色时慢慢消散。无论是在汉普斯特德希思画下看到的叶子，还是在我叔叔的画室里尝试泼洒颜料，创作的过程都会让我进入一种宁静、近乎梦幻的状态。我的思绪放缓，呼吸平稳，完全失去时间感——只剩下手中铅笔的触感和画面在纸上渐渐成形。这既是一种温柔的逃离，也是一种无需言语就能倾诉想法的方式。创作结束后，我总感到神清气爽，仿佛清理了头脑，为第二天的冒险腾出了更多空间。

questions.question_en: What steps do you follow to wash up and prepare for bed, and do you have a favorite bedtime story or routine?
questions.question_ch: 你在洗漱和准备睡觉时会遵循哪些步骤？你有没有最喜欢的睡前故事或习惯？
questions.answer_en: I usually start my bedtime routine around 9:30: first I clear away my sketchbook and science notes, then head to the bathroom with my trusty handkerchief. I brush my teeth thoroughly with fluoride toothpaste, rinse my face with warm water, pat it dry, and change into my favorite grey dinosaur-print pajamas. Back in my room I pack my bag for tomorrow—checking my timetable on the door, slipping in my handkerchief, binoculars and homework folder—and set my 7 a.m. alarm. Once the lights are dimmed I snuggle under my wool blanket and ask Dad or Mum to read me a chapter of Charlotte’s Web (I love the way the barnyard comes alive in the last light of day). By the time Wilbur and Charlotte finish their adventure, I’m usually fast asleep.
questions.answer_ch: 我通常在九点半左右开始我的睡前流程：首先收拾好速写本和科学笔记，然后拿着我心爱的手帕去洗手间。我用含氟牙膏彻底刷牙，用温水洗脸，轻轻拍干，然后换上我最喜欢的灰色恐龙图案睡衣。回到房间后，我收拾好明天要用的东西——在门上看一下课程表，把手帕、望远镜和作业文件夹放进书包——然后设定好早上七点的闹钟。灯光调暗后，我钻进羊毛毯里，央求爸爸或妈妈给我读《夏洛的网》的一章（我最喜欢夕阳下农场的景象）。当威尔伯和夏洛完成他们的冒险时，我通常已经睡着了。

questions.question_en: What do you dream about when you fall asleep each night, and how do those dreams influence your next day?
questions.question_ch: 你每晚入睡时会梦到什么，这些梦境如何影响你第二天的生活？
questions.answer_en: When I fall asleep each night, I often find myself carried into strange, half-remembered places—sometimes I’m drifting above the trees in a silver mist, watching starlike fireflies flicker below; other times I stand before a vast, columned hall lined with books that hum with quiet promise, and my great-grandmother Orla appears to hand me a glowing flower called the “Light of the Elves.” In another dream I’m back on the Jurassic Coast, digging gently in the sand until a gleaming tooth of an ancient sea creature comes into view. These dreams always leave me buzzing with questions when I wake: I sketch the flower’s spirals in my notebook, plan new fossil-hunting trips, or spend breakfast imagining what the midnight library’s shelves might hold. By morning I’m eager to draw, read, or brave the misty park for hidden butterflies, because those nighttime adventures remind me that even the smallest discovery—whether a fossil fragment or a new idea—can feel as magical as flying through moonlit skies.
questions.answer_ch: 每晚入睡时，我常被带入那些奇异而模糊的境地——有时我漂浮在树梢之上，银色薄雾环绕，俯瞰下方闪烁如星的萤火虫；有时我站在一座宏伟的柱廊大厅里，两侧摆满低声吟唱着静谧承诺的图书，这时我的曾祖母奥拉出现，递给我一朵名为“精灵之光”的发光花。在另一个梦境里，我又回到侏罗纪海岸，轻轻在沙中挖掘，直到一颗古老海洋生物的闪亮牙齿浮现。这些梦总在醒来时留给我无数疑问：我在笔记本上描绘花朵的螺旋图案，计划新的化石探险，或是在早餐时想象午夜图书馆的书架上藏有哪些秘密。清晨，我便迫不及待地拿起画笔、打开书本，或者冒着薄雾去公园寻找隐藏的蝴蝶，因为那些夜间冒险让我明白，即便是最微小的发现——无论是一块化石碎片还是一个新想法——也能如月光下的飞行般神奇。
